title: Sr. Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
description:
**Your work days are brighter here.**
 Weâ€™re obsessed with making hard work pay off, for our people, our customers, and the world around us. As a Fortune 500 company and a leading AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, weâ€™re shaping the future of work so teams can reach their potential and focus on what matters most. The minute you join, youâ€™ll feel it. Not just in the products we build, but in how we show up for each other. Our culture is rooted in integrity, empathy, and shared enthusiasm. Weâ€™re in this together, tackling big challenges with bold ideas and genuine care. We look for curious minds and courageous collaborators who bring sun\\-drenched optimism and drive. Whether you're building smarter solutions, supporting customers, or creating a space where everyone belongs, youâ€™ll do meaningful work with Workmates whoâ€™ve got your back. In return, weâ€™ll give you the trust to take risks, the tools to grow, the skills to develop and the support of a company invested in you for the long haul. So, if you want to inspire a brighter work day for everyone, including yourself, youâ€™ve found a match in Workday, and we hope to be a match for you too.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We're a fast\\-paced start\\-up\\-like team working on one of Workday's newest innovative products, Workday Scheduling. Workday Scheduling enables employers to schedule their workforce efficiently while also empowering workers to take ownership over their availability and preferences. Our product consists of a sophisticated user experience (browser \\& mobile) and an engine that leverages artificial intelligence to calculate an efficient work schedule that satisfies the needs of both employers and workers. Join in on an outstanding opportunity to positively impact our product and team at every stage of development.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to play a key role in driving quality strategy, automation excellence, and functional testing leadership across one or more product areas.
   

  

 This is a hybrid role where you will combine deep functional testing expertise with strong automation skills, while also influencing test strategy, framework improvements, and overall quality practices within the team.
   

  

**Ideal candidate should have:**
* Deep experience defining and implementing functional, regression, and exploratory test strategies, with the ability to assess and prioritize risk across features and services for comprehensive coverage.
* Strong technical background in architecting, designing, and evolving JavaScript/TypeScript\\-based test automation frameworks.
* Advanced debugging skills to investigate complex test failures, intermittent issues, and production defects, drive root\\-cause analysis, and implement systemic, long\\-term fixes.
* Proactively evaluates emerging QA and automation trends, tools, and practices, and leads the introduction of improvements that raise the quality bar for the team.
* Acts as a strong cross\\-functional partner and quality advocate, effectively collaborating and influencing across distributed teams to align on quality goals, standards, and testing guidelines.


**About You**
**Responsibilities:**
* Own and implement end\\-to\\-end quality strategy for multiple features or product areas.
* Lead complex functional, integration, and regression testing efforts, including risk assessment and test planning.
* Design, enhance, and maintain scalable and reliable automation frameworks using JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Write high\\-quality automated tests and set standards for test structure, coverage, and maintainability.
* Actively monitor and stabilize build pipelines, triaging failures and resolving flaky or intermittent issues.
* Perform deep debugging across automation, application code, and test environments to identify root causes.
* Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance on testing standards.
* Partner closely with developers, product managers, and UX designers to improve testability and quality outcomes.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in QA and test automation and introduce improvements where appropriate.


**Basic Qualifications**
* 8\\+ years of experience in test automation, quality engineering, or software development.
* Strong experience in functional testing of complex systems, including edge cases and failure scenarios.
* Advanced proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript for automation development.
* Solid experience working with modern automation frameworks like Playwright, WebdriverIO, and Cypress.
* Practical experience using element locators (XPath, CSS Selectors).
* Solid object\\-oriented programming and test design principles.
* Experience supporting automated testing in continuous integration and delivery environments. (Jenkins, Bamboo, or similar).
* Proficient with Git and collaborative development workflows.
* Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science or equivalent experience.


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Experience with web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Experience with mobile automation testing.
* Exposure to performance, load, or security testing.
* Experience working in an agile/scrum environment.


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, weâ€™re combining the best of both worlds: in\\-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in\\-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

 At Workday, we are committed to providing an accessible and inclusive hiring experience where all candidates can fully demonstrate their skills. If you require assistance or an accommodation at any point, please email accommodations@workday.com.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 At Workday, we value our candidatesâ€™ privacy and data security. Workday will never ask candidates to apply to jobs through websites that are not Workday Careers.
   

  

 Please be aware of sites that may ask for you to input your data in connection with a job posting that appears to be from Workday but is not.
   

  

 In addition, Workday will never ask candidates to pay a recruiting fee, or pay for consulting or coaching services, in order to apply for a job at Workday.

title: SDET â€“ QA AUTOMATION ENGINEER
description:
At OakNorth, weâ€™re on a mission to empower the UKâ€™s most ambitious businesses. Since 2015, weâ€™ve lent over $18 billion across the UK and US, helped create more than 58,000 new homes and 36,000 new jobs, and supported hundreds of thousands of personal savers â€” all while fuelling the UK economy.
   

  

**Team Mission ðŸš€**
 We are looking for a hands\\-on SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) with 4â€“5 years of
   

  

 experience in automation, primarily in Java, functional testing of front\\-end applications.
   

  

 The role will cover UI and/or API automation in a dynamiclending/banking domain, built on
   

  

 AWS cloud infrastructure
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* API layers.

 Key Attributes
   

  

* ï‚·Personal drive (proactive), responsible, and result\\-oriented.

**Key Attributes**
* Personal drive (proactive), responsible, and result\\-oriented.
* Flexible, curious, creative thinker with strong problem\\-solving skills.
* Fast learner with the ability to adapt to evolving technologies and frameworks.
* Strong team player with excellent collaboration and communication skills.
* Domain experience in lending, credit risk, banking channels (digital banking, SME lending,


 commercial lending).
   

  

**Education**

title: Senior Software Developer - Authentication
description:
**Your work days are brighter here.**
 Weâ€™re obsessed with making hard work pay off, for our people, our customers, and the world around us. As a Fortune 500 company and a leading AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, weâ€™re shaping the future of work so teams can reach their potential and focus on what matters most. The minute you join, youâ€™ll feel it. Not just in the products we build, but in how we show up for each other. Our culture is rooted in integrity, empathy, and shared enthusiasm. Weâ€™re in this together, tackling big challenges with bold ideas and genuine care. We look for curious minds and courageous collaborators who bring sun\\-drenched optimism and drive. Whether you're building smarter solutions, supporting customers, or creating a space where everyone belongs, youâ€™ll do meaningful work with Workmates whoâ€™ve got your back. In return, weâ€™ll give you the trust to take risks, the tools to grow, the skills to develop and the support of a company invested in you for the long haul. So, if you want to inspire a brighter work day for everyone, including yourself, youâ€™ve found a match in Workday, and we hope to be a match for you too.
   

  

**About The Team**
 At Workday, the Authentication Security team is the cornerstone of our user trust and safety. We build and maintain the critical services that act as the front door to our entire ecosystem. Our mission is to provide secure, scalable, and seamless access for millions of users, protecting their data while enabling a frictionless experience. We are a team of passionate engineers dedicated to solving complex challenges in the authentication and identity space!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced Senior Software Developer to join our Authentication Security team. This is a critical role for a hands\\-on engineer who is passionate about building high\\-scale distributed systems and robust security infrastructure. You will work closely with the team to architect and implement critical authentication standards (OIDC, SSO, SAML, FIDO), while ensuring our services remain resilient under heavy load. As a technical leader you will thrive in ambiguity, turning abstract security requirements into concrete, robust solutions. If you are a problem\\-solver who enjoys navigating complex security architecture, and mentoring others to do the same, this is your opportunity to shape the future of our platform.
   

  

 What Youâ€™ll Do
   

  

* Partner with leaders in engineering and products to define the vision, strategy, and roadmap for the security platform
* Design and build high\\-performance services, libraries, and APIs that keep authentication reliable and secure.
* Work closely with support and engineering teams to address customer issues, fix bugs, and build new features.
* Participate in on\\-call rotation and lead incident response for services to restore service quickly during events.
* The ability to work well with technical and non\\-technical people to deliver high\\-value results.
* Develop tools to enhance code reliability and streamline adoption of our security services
* Excellence when working autonomously, knowing when to seek help from team members.
* Leverage good software design patterns and principles
* Contribute to a collaborative team culture that encourages iteration and innovation.


**About You**
 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

* 7\\+ years of software development experience, leading technical initiatives, designing complex systems, and ensuring the scalability and maintainability of software products
* 7\\+ years of experience in object oriented programming such as Java, Scala, Kotlin
* Deep understanding of patterns for resilient services such as backpressure, idempotency, timeouts, and circuit\\-breaking strategies.
* Deep expertise and experience in API Development (REST) and designing and building microservices
* Bachelor's degree in a computer related field or equivalent work experience
* Strong understanding of IAM Concepts.
* Knowledge/ experience with developing security, identity, authentication, authorization solutions and open standards such as SAML and OIDC


 Other Qualifications:
   

  

* Expert knowledge of identity protocols and standards, including OAuth 2\\.0, OpenID Connect (OIDC), and SAML.
* Knowledge of different data storage technologies, such as Redis and MySQL.
* Working experience with source control and CI/CD tools such as Git, BitBucket, Jenkins.
* Knowledge of Docker and container orchestration frameworks such as Kubernetes.
* Experience with observability and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or OpenTelemetry.
* Proven ability in writing technical design documents and collaborating within a software development team
* Experience with relational database technologies (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQL Server)


 Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
   

  

 Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

title: PLATFORM ENGINEERING
description:
At OakNorth, weâ€™re on a mission to empower the UKâ€™s most ambitious businesses. Since 2015, weâ€™ve lent over $18 billion across the UK and US, helped create more than 58,000 new homes and 36,000 new jobs, and supported hundreds of thousands of personal savers â€” all while fuelling the UK economy.
   

  

**Team Mission ðŸš€**
 We're building a new
 **Product Engineering Experience (aka Developer Experience)** 
 team with one goal: empower every product engineer at OakNorth to ship faster, safer, and with greater autonomy.
   

  

 We do this by building platforms and partnering closely with product teams to understand friction, shape workflows and drive adoption of golden paths.
   

  

 We believe the best developer experience is AI\\-native by design, not bolted on as an afterthought. Our team builds the tools, frameworks, pipelines, and automation that make it effortless for engineers to go from idea to production. Think AI\\-assisted local dev setup, intelligent CI/CD, self\\-service infrastructure, AI agents embedded across the SDLC to enable both technical and non\\-technical contributors and documentation that writes itself. We're a small, high\\-impact team distributed across the UK, India, and the EU, and we're looking for someone who wants to define what modern developer experience looks like inside a regulated fintech.
   

  

**The role**
* You're the kind of engineer who gets frustrated when developers waste time on things that should be automated and then builds the thing that fixes it. You:
* Have 4\\+ experience building developer tooling and internal platforms \\- you've created self\\-service systems, CLI tools, SDKs, or internal APIs, and iterating on them based off feedback and real\\-world usage to measurably improve developer productivity
* Think AI\\-first when designing solutions \\- you think automation in terms of agents and workflows. Naturally reaching for LLMs, AI code generation, and intelligent automation as building blocks, not novelties.
* Use AI tools daily to accelerate your work â€“ whether it be forcoding, debugging, reviews or documentation, youâ€™re well versed in leveraging AI to 10x your impact
* Have strong end\\-to\\-end knowledge of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) \\- from discovery, planning, defining, coding, testing, deployment and operations. You understand how each phase connects and where friction hides, and you've used that understanding where to automate, streamline, and improve the entire flow, not just one piece of it
* Are passionate about CI/CD and release automation \\- you've built or significantly improved build systems, designed deployment pipelines that give engineers confidence to ship continuously and understand dependency management
* Measure your success in developer productivity, not lines of code \\- you care about DORA metrics, onboarding time to first commit, cycle time, and automation effectiveness. You've used frameworks like DORA, Core 4 or SPACE to drive measurable improvements
* Understand the value of great documentation and onboarding \\- you've built or championed AI\\-automated documentation, self\\-updating runbooks, or knowledge\\-sharing systems that actually get used
* Are comfortable working in a regulated environment \\- you understand that "move fast" in financial services means moving fast safely, with appropriate guardrails, audit trails, and compliance awareness
* Embrace DevOps culture: You build it, you run it \\- you take end\\-to\\-end ownership and you're not waiting for someone else to deploy, monitor, or fix what you've built
* Operate with strong opinions, held loosely \\- you bring a clear point of view on how developer experience should work but you listen, learn and adapt when the evidence says otherwise
* Communicate clearly across distributed teams \\- you work effectively with colleagues across multiple timezones, write excellent and clear documentation, and default to transparency
* It would be an added bonus if you:
* Have worked at a fintech, bank or other regulated business
* Have experience building or customising developer portals (e.g., Backstage or similar service catalogues)
* Have integrated tools like GitHub Copilot, LLM APIs, or AI\\-powered code review into real engineering workflows
* Have experience with AI\\-powered risk detection, intelligent test generation or AI\\-assisted code review at scale


**Technology**
* Python
* LLMs \\& AI tooling (we're outcome\\-driven and vendor\\-agnostic)
* PostgreSQL, MySQL, BigQuery
* TypeScript, React
* AWS, GCP
* Docker, Terraform, GitHub Actions

title: Senior Placement Manager (Hyderabad)
description:
**About Us**
 Fireblaze AI School is a part of Fireblaze Technologies which was started in April 2018 with a Vision to Up\\-Skill and Train in emerging technologies.
   

  

 Mission Statement
   

  

 â€œTo Provide Measurable \\& Transformational Value To Learners Careerâ€

 â€œâ€œTo Be The Most Successful \\& Respected Job\\-Oriented Training Provider Globally.â€
   

  

 We Focus widely on creating a huge digital impact. Hence Our Strong Presence over Digital Platforms are a must have thing for use. Below Are the links to all the social media channels.
   

  

* Website \\- http://fireblazeaischool.in
* LinkedIN \\- https://www.linkedin.com/company/fireblazeaischool/

* Google Pune \\- https://g.page/fireblazeaischoolpune?share

**Job Description**
 Corporate Outreach \\& Relations
   

  

 Build and maintain strong relationships with companies in the tech and IT sectors for hiring partnerships.
   

  

 Create and pitch talent acquisition proposals to potential recruiters.
   

  

 Organize recruitment drives, job fairs, and placement weeks.
   

  

 Student Placement Strategy
   

  

 Plan and execute end\\-to\\-end placement processes for students enrolled in technical programs (Data Science, Full Stack, Cloud, AI, etc.).
   

  

 Maintain placement records and track KPIs such as placement ratio, average package, and recruiter feedback.
   

  

 Collaboration \\& Communication
   

  

 Work closely with academic and operations teams to ensure student readiness for interviews.
   

  

 Guide students on resumes, LinkedIn profiles, mock interviews, and placement etiquette.
   

  

 Market Intelligence
   

  

 Stay updated with hiring trends, skills in demand, and domain\\-specific requirements to improve placement outcomes.
